Question: Navigation Instruction given at initial position: [go to sidewalk and turn on first walk way. turn right over tennis court. stop by nearest lake. face towards right of the subdivision. fly low and fly in open area near shed. move forward and face towards the park. take off, to fountain in center of park. make a sharp left on lake and go to nearest bridge. move forward beyond patio area.. fly over third row of trees.]. You move according to a series of movement instructions. At this point, what is your best next step?  
choose:  
A. I go up and turn left.  
B. I descend and fly forward.  
C. I fly forward while rising.  
D. I turn right and descend.  
E. I rotate the camera downward.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: B; Reason: The current view shows an open area near a body of water, which aligns with the instruction to "fly low and fly in open area near shed." The next logical step based on the given instructions is to descend and fly forward, as this will help in moving towards the park and subsequently locating the fountain, adhering to the sequence of the navigation instructions.

Given the current view from the bridge and the instruction to go to the nearest bridge, the next logical step is to go up and turn left to continue following the path.

The instruction to "fly low and fly in open area near shed" might have already been fulfilled, and the focus should now be on reaching the fountain in the center of the park after the bridge.
